results.title: Abridge Raises $250 Million in Series D - October 2024
results.content: Abridge successfully raised **$250 Million** in this Series D funding round. **IVP (Institutional Venture Partners)** (Co-Lead Investor): Leading late-stage venture capital firm co-leading the round **Bessemer Venture Partners** (Investor): Long-term venture capital firm participating in the round Ventures** (Investor): Venture capital firm participating in the round **Lightspeed Venture Partners** (Investor): Multi-stage venture capital firm **NVentures (NVIDIA)** (Strategic Investor): NVIDIA's venture capital arm providing AI compute expertise **Redpoint Ventures** (Investor): Early-stage and growth venture capital firm **Spark Capital** (Investor): Technology-focused venture capital firm Entrepreneur and investor co-leading the Series D round Leading late-stage venture capital firm co-leading the round Long-term venture capital firm participating in the round Venture capital firm participating in the round Series D(258)NVIDIA(4)Healthcare AI(1)Clinical Documentation(1)Generative AI(1)EHR Integration(1)

results.title: AI Note-Taking Startup Abridge Raises $300M As Tech To ...
results.content: # AI Note-Taking Startup Abridge Raises $300M As Tech To Reduce Physician Burnout Gains Traction Abridge, a startup that offers an AI note-taking tool for doctors, raised $300 million at a $5.3 billion valuation, according to The Wall Street Journal. Along with Abridge — which has now raised $757.5 million total from investors, per Crunchbase — other well-funded startups in the AI healthcare documentation space include: Overall, funding to startups at the intersection of AI and healthcare hit $7.5 billion in 2024. * Rounds Raised By Startups Using AI, 2025 Artificial intelligence • Crypto • M&A • Regional • Seed funding • Startups • Venture

results.title: Abridge Emerges as a Healthcare AI Leader, Raising $150M
results.content: PITTSBURGH, PA (February 23, 2024) – Abridge, the leader in generative AI for clinical documentation, announced an additional $150 million investment, leveraging momentum from their product’s rapid uptake among health systems throughout the nation. This raise comes just 4 months after their [$30M Series B](https://www.abridge.com/press/abridge-raises-30m-to-accelerate-adoption-of-its-proven-generative-ai-solution-across-u-s-healthcare-systems), and is one of the largest funding rounds made to date in generative AI for healthcare. “Abridge has set new standards for quality and responsible deployment of generative AI in health systems across the U.S., cementing it as the industry’s most trusted AI platform,” said Sebastian Duesterhoeft, Partner at Lightspeed Venture Partners. As pioneers in generative AI for healthcare, Abridge is setting the industry standards for the responsible deployment of AI across health systems.

results.title: Abridge, Whose AI App Takes Notes for Doctors, Valued at ...
results.content: Abridge, Whose AI App Takes Notes for Doctors, Valued at $5.3 Billion at Funding. Startup raises $300 million in round led by Andreessen

results.title: Abridge secures $300M, doubling valuation and fueling ...
results.content: Venture capital firms Andreessen Horowitz and Khosla Ventures led the round, the Pittsburgh-based startup announced yesterday, bringing Abridge’s valuation to roughly $5.3 billion. Abridge’s product, an AI tool that it says it hopes to reduce burnout by simplifying medical discussions with patients, will support around 50 million medical conversations this year, according to a blog post announcing the raise. Abridge has so far been at the top of Pittsburgh’s venture capital raises in recent years, raking in nearly half of Pittsburgh’s decade-high $689 million raised in Q1 2025. The most recent raise announcement comes after Abridge said in March that it was moving to hire in San Francisco, citing a need to hire “hundreds” to meet current demand.

AI Note-Taking Startup Abridge Raises $300M As Tech To ...
# AI Note-Taking Startup Abridge Raises $300M As Tech To Reduce Physician Burnout Gains Traction Abridge, a startup that offers an AI note-taking tool for doctors, raised $300 million at a $5.3 billion valuation, according to The Wall Street Journal. Along with Abridge — which has now raised $757.5 million total from investors, per Crunchbase — other well-funded startups in the AI healthcare documentation space include: Overall, funding to startups at the intersection of AI and healthcare hit $7.5 billion in 2024. * Rounds Raised By Startups Using AI, 2025 Artificial intelligence • Crypto • M&A • Regional • Seed funding • Startups • Venture

Abridge Emerges as a Healthcare AI Leader, Raising $150M
PITTSBURGH, PA (February 23, 2024) – Abridge, the leader in generative AI for clinical documentation, announced an additional $150 million investment, leveraging momentum from their product’s rapid uptake among health systems throughout the nation. This raise comes just 4 months after their [$30M Series B](https://www.abridge.com/press/abridge-raises-30m-to-accelerate-adoption-of-its-proven-generative-ai-solution-across-u-s-healthcare-systems), and is one of the largest funding rounds made to date in generative AI for healthcare. “Abridge has set new standards for quality and responsible deployment of generative AI in health systems across the U.S., cementing it as the industry’s most trusted AI platform,” said Sebastian Duesterhoeft, Partner at Lightspeed Venture Partners. As pioneers in generative AI for healthcare, Abridge is setting the industry standards for the responsible deployment of AI across health systems.

Abridge, Whose AI App Takes Notes for Doctors, Valued at $5.3 Billion at Funding. Startup raises $300 million in round led by Andreessen

Abridge secures $300M, doubling valuation and fueling ...
Venture capital firms Andreessen Horowitz and Khosla Ventures led the round, the Pittsburgh-based startup announced yesterday, bringing Abridge’s valuation to roughly $5.3 billion. Abridge’s product, an AI tool that it says it hopes to reduce burnout by simplifying medical discussions with patients, will support around 50 million medical conversations this year, according to a blog post announcing the raise. Abridge has so far been at the top of Pittsburgh’s venture capital raises in recent years, raking in nearly half of Pittsburgh’s decade-high $689 million raised in Q1 2025. The most recent raise announcement comes after Abridge said in March that it was moving to hire in San Francisco, citing a need to hire “hundreds” to meet current demand.
